The room was well appointed, the internet connection was good. The front desk, valet parking and restaurant employees were all efficient and friendly. There were not special amenities but the usual were provided. Would I stay there again? Frankly, LAX is such a horrible airport experience I would hope I never would have to (!) but I certainly wouldn't rule this out. A ocouple of blocks away is a regular Marriott that looked very nice. The Sheraton also looked nice and has a Shuler's restaurant.. I might choose one of those.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a girl on her own in LA!”
Reviews.Author: Deepa8
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to LA.....I was a bit nervous about staying in a cheaper place so I decided to splurge a bit for safety reasons.....I was due to land in LAX around 11 pm. I paid $126 over travelocity ($60 cheaper than the price on the spot), they had a free airport shuttle to the hotel and I was really satisfied....check out time is noon but I simply requested an extended checkout and stayed til 3 pm for no extra charge. Everyone at the hotel was very nice, the room was huge! and extremely clean. Great place..........I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: m_estrada
Reviews.Content: Four of us booked a double room to stay for 3 nights over memorial day weekend, and it was perfect for our needs. I appreciated: -the non-smoking policy in the entire hotel -friendly staff -7th floor room was spacious, clean with comfy beds -windows could be opened in room -food was decent -pre-departure check out slipped under door -free fridge in room -valet parking was fine for 15 per day -i didn't hear any noise from the room next door so it was quiet -free internet in room (not sure if it's free for whole stay or one day only; we only used it for one day) i would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff with great positive attitude”
Reviews.Author: DWGriffith
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before an early flight back to the eastern time zone. The staff was unusually forthcoming and effective. This extended even to the valet parking people, who clued us in to ask for a ride back from Hertz after we dropped the rental car, thus avoiding the double ride to the airport and then waiting for another shuttle to the hotel. Rooms are somewhat oddly laid out, but it didn't matter. And the beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable and efficient”
Reviews.Author: DeeTa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott after a long flight from London and wanted a night's sleep befor driving on to our house in Palm Desert. We have tried other LAX hotels and had some really bad experiences (esp. at the LAX Howard Johnson). This hotel was brilliantly situated (right in the airport by the big LAX sign and not postioned under the flightpaths (therefore quiet). The room was very large and very nicely decorated in a Japanese style with a good bathroom. The bed was very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful , welcoming and smiled a lot! We had a meal in the small cafe area and the waiter couldn't do enough for us. Thank you Marriott Courtyard for restoring our faith in LAX hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good busienss hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimtexas
Reviews.Content: For a hotel "designed by and for business travelers" this hotel lacks an absolutely critical item: a speaker phone in the room. Yes, that's right, there are no speaker phones in the room. When asking for one at the front desk at 6am, I was met with "I don't think we have any." When prodded with a response of "please go find out for certain," I was met with completely dumbfounded expressions and absolutely no immediate action. I was told that maybe "engineering" would know, but they wouldn't be in until 7am. When asked for a manager on duty, I was told the managers would not arrive until 9am. Turning from the front desk in angst, I saw the breakfast buffet, I specifically asked what the cost was for a bagel. I was told that the breakfast buffet was $13! $13 for a bagel! Maybe it was the early hour feeding my angst, but I am absolutely shocked that a business hotel does not have speaker phones in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I won this hotel on a $41 Priceline bid. I needed a place nearby the airport because my family was in the process of moving to the South Pacific and we had several large containers which needed to be stored during our layover in L.A. First, we arrived at the airport at midnight. The shuttle was there at the airport immediately. The driver was extremely courteous and returned 2 times to pick up all of our luggage. The staff at the hotel was excellent. They saw we had a family of five, and they upgraded us to a 1 BR suite on the 6th floor. It was amazing. It had plenty of room for our luggage, and it gave my wife and I some privacy. The staff was always eager to help any issue we encountered. Maid service was excellent and they had no problem letting us sleep in and cleaning the room at a later time. Valet parking was sort of a drag, but I knew to expect it in the LAX region. Besides, I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights, and they only charged me for one night's parking. This is not a 4 star hotel, but if you're looking for a great, affordable place to stay in LAX, this is your hotel! It was by far the best hotel experience I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely tailored for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Karch72
Reviews.Content: I wasn't in LA on business, but stayed there anyways. Rooms are very large, nicely decorated and the beds were ultra-comfortable. A clean property as well. Weird room set-up... there's a closet divider that separates the desk area from the bed. I guess that provides some privacy if you're doing business work. If you're planning on using the fitness center, don't expect too much. A couple of treadmills and an outdated combination weight machine. The hot tub outside of the fitness center looked OK, however. Plusses: Free coffee in the morning, free paper, small convenience store in the hotel for toiletries and snacks (can charge to room) Negatives: Can only valet park for $14 per day (with slow service), no views from room No surprises here. Courtyards are known for catering to the business traveler and this property will not disappoint. However, if you're looking for some frills and added amenities, you may want to go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Very close to LAX. The rooms are large, beds are extra comfy. The staff are friendly and helpful. No self parking, only valet, then again you pay to park your car either way when staying at any of the hotels near LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Friendly, Comfortable LAX Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LakersFan
Reviews.Content: While I only spent about six hours at the LAX Courtyard hotel, I was impressed with the service, property and convenience. The reason for my short stay was an early morning flight out of LAX. I arrived at the hotel and the valet immediately took my car. Valet parking is only $13.00 per day which is very reasonable for the LAX area. Check in was fast and efficient. I received my preferred room type, a king non-smoking room. The only reason check-in took more that 60 seconds was that I wanted to prepay the four day parking charges. My room was #526, facing the airport to the west. I was a little concerned that it might be noisy, but the rooms are very well insulated. It was a very quiet room. As expected from a Marriott property, the room was spotless and smelled fresh. The room was excellent! It had a layout that I have never seen before. It was quite large with a wardrobe unit dividing the room into a work area and sleep area. The desk was excellent with a good office style chair, complimentary HS internet connection, and a good work light. The only thing missing was easy to reach electrical outlets (they were under the desk). The bath vanity was well lit and had a granite top and a small refrigerator under it. The bathroom had a large tub-shower combination and a great and unique shower head. There were plenty of towels. The king bed was comfortable, but was not one of the new super comfortable Marriott beds. There were five foam pillows in my room rather than the typical Courtyard mix of feather and foam pillows. The bedding was the new style that is changed with each guest. The entire wall next to the bed was windowed. Across from the king bed was a sofa, the bureau, and TV. The TV had the expected cable channels as well as PPV movies. Lighting in the room was excellent. The only thing that I missed was easy to reach electrical outlets. I think this hotel was built just before Marriott started installing lamps and lighting fixtures with electrical outlets in them. I wanted some milk to drink before retiring for the night. I went down to the lobby bar and the when I asked the associate if he said he would be glad to get me either 2% or fat free. While waiting for my milk I noticed several people eating at the bar which makes me think that food is served around the clock at this hotel. Also in the lobby area is a business center and The Market with snacks, soft drinks, beer, wine, and ice cream. I asked for a 4:00 AM wake up call and it came on-time. The bill for my stay had been slid under the door and was correct, including my prepaid parking. Exiting the hotel the valet asked if I needed a ride to the airport and he immediately brought the van around. I was through security at the American Airlines terminal 45 minutes after my wake up call. This is a great hotel if you have an early flight! Every associate that I came in contact with at the Courtyard was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very close to LAX and is easy to get in and out of. I can recommend it highly.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard Los Angeles LAX/Century Boulevard
HotelInfo.Address: 6161 W Century Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90045
